articles.title: Lessons in Trust From us-east-1

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Techland has announced that it'll take around 500 hours to fully complete its survival game, Dying Light 2.
"To fully complete Dying Light 2 Stay Human, you'll need at least 500 hours - almost as long as it would take to walk from Warsaw to Madrid!" the studio stated in a tweet.
Read more
articles.title: Dying Light 2 will take "at least" 500 hours to complete, says Techland

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Rust has sold over 12 million copies.
Making the announcement in a new year round-up, developer Facepunch revealed that as well as selling 12,481,079 copies of the game, it's also sold over one million DLC packs - a surprisingly modest number, given the number of people invested in the vanilla game, perhaps? - and has over 400,000 users on its Discord server.
Read more
articles.title: Rust has sold over 12 million copies

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
A new anime series based upon Scott Pilgrim is coming to Netflix. 
According to Hollywood Reporter, Netflix is working alongside UCP - the division of Universal Studio Group behind The Umbrella Academy and Chucky - to develop the brand-new adaptation with anime house Science SARU "on tap to provide the animation work".
Read more
articles.title: A Scott Pilgrim anime show is in the works

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Apex Legends developer Respawn is exploring "what [it] can do" about "visual clutter" in the fan-favourite first-person shooter.
Boasting fluid gunplay and a distinctive artistic style, free-to-play battle royale Apex Legends is a fan-favourite, but some players purport that the game's HUD has become increasingly cluttered, particularly when they're under attack in-game. 
Read more
articles.title: Apex Legends developer is looking at "what it can do" about the game's "visual clarity"

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Details of a new - and hitherto unannounced - instalment of From Software's Armored Core have reportedly popped up online.
According to ResetEra's Red Liquorice, earlier today they received a consumer survey directly from the developer which offered plot details, eight screenshots, and even two videos about the unannounced sequel.  
Read more
articles.title: Details of an unannounced From Software Armored Core game have reportedly popped up online

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Sega has abandoned plans to embrace NFTs following "negative reactions" from gamers.
In an interview with Tweak Town, Sega CEO Haruki Satomi acknowledged the publisher would like to "try out various [NFT] experiments", but was quick to say "nothing is decided at this point" and the company would have to "carefully assess" "what will be accepted and what will not be by the users".
Read more
articles.title: Sega stalls NFT plans following "negative reactions" from players

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Amazon Studios has plans to improve the end-game of its MMO, New World.
In a lengthy blog post on the official website, the team explained how "expedition mutators" will improve challenge and enjoyment of the game for those who've already experienced much of what the MMO has to offer. 
Read more
articles.title: Amazon outlines improvements to New World's end-game

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Gary McKay has written candidly about his first year as general manager at BioWare, describing how the studio continues to adapt during the coronavirus pandemic, and how it intends to "rebuild [its] reputation" following the cancellation of its live-service shooter, Anthem.
"This has been another challenging year, with both work and home life continuing to be disrupted by the uncertainty of the global pandemic," McKay wrote in a blog on the official BioWare website. "We've had to continue to think on our feet to adapt to changing circumstances. 
Read more
articles.title: BioWare is "laser-focused on building back the trust of our fans and community"

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Remember that brief Serious Sam teaser that had fans thinking a new instalment - or, in the very least, new DLC - might be on the way? Turns out they were right, and a new Serious Sam is set to release later this month.
Croteam dropped a cryptic video tease just before Christmas, but at just 34 seconds long and the description "man, it's cold", we didn't have a lot to go on. 
Read more
articles.title: A new Serious Sam game may release later this month

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
The offer is part of the platform's regular Free Play Days scheme open to anyone with an Xbox Live Gold or Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription.
Read more
articles.title: Battlefield 2042 is free to try this weekend on Xbox

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Mario Kart 9 is now in "active development" within Nintendo, according to Tokyo-based industry consultant Dr. Serkan Toto. 
The continued sales success of Mario Kart 8 Deluxe had left many fans wondering if Nintendo was still planning an all-new Mario Kart for Nintendo Switch - or whether the platform would just be left with its hugely-popular Wii U port.
Read more
articles.title: Mario Kart 9 in active development, industry consultant says

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The latest update to Red Dead Online has not gone down well with players.
Rockstar shared an update for the new year, which includes experience bonuses and a handful of other extras for the next month, specifically for the A Land of Opportunities, Call to Arms, and Gang Hideouts events.
Read more
articles.title: Red Dead Online players are disappointed with latest meagre update

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
The Ascent looks set for launch on PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 soon.
Gematsu spotted a listing for The Ascent on the website of the Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB). This follows a similar listing spotted last month in Taiwan. I imagine an announcement isn't too far off.
Read more
articles.title: The Ascent looks set for PS5 and PS4 after ESRB listing spotted

articles.author: Robert Purchese
articles.description:
Very good adventure game Lair of the Clockwork God is getting a fancypants, Limited Run, physical release on Switch and PS4.
I'm delighted because I've got a soft spot for Lair of the Clockwork God. I reviewed it on PC in 2020 and loved it. It's an adventure game and sometimes a platform game about two characters, Dan and Ben. And they bicker, endlessly. One represents point-and-clicks, and the other, platformers. And they don't always get along.
Read more
articles.title: Superb adventure game Lair of the Clockwork God getting a fancypants Limited Run release

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Days Gone staff discussed a potential open-world Resistance game and a Syphon Filter reboot with higher-ups at PlayStation.
Jeff Ross, the director of Days Gone who left Sony in late 2020, discussed some of these pitch ideas last night via video chat with former Twisted Metal developer David Jaffe. During the call, he went into further detail on how his hopes for a Days Gone sequel were squashed.
Read more
articles.title: Days Gone director pitched open-world Resistance

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Since the release of Final Fantasy 7 Remake on PC, modders have been hard at work playing around.
Now one fan has recreated the game with the classic fixed camera of the PS1 original.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 7 fan recreates remake with classic PS1 camera

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
The California and Virginia-based studio, which most recently released 2019 co-op horror The Blackout Club, revealed its South Park project via a new job listing. 
Read more
articles.title: The Magic Circle studio working on South Park game

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Christina Aguilera stars in the latest Nintendo Switch advert, offering a glimpse of the forthcoming Pokémon Legends: Arceus.
She's just the latest in a string of popstars playing Nintendo. Remember Beyoncé having a blast with Rhythm Heaven on the DS? Or when Girls Aloud battled it out playing Mario Kart?
Read more
articles.title: Christina Aguilera has played Pokémon Legends: Arceus before you

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Russell Lees, a video games industry veteran with a long career at Ubisoft, has passed away. 
Word of Lees' death was shared on Twitter last night by Assassin's Creed narrative director Darby McDevitt, who led tributes to his colleague.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed veteran Russell Lees dies

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Who knew Pope Francis was a fan of Undertale?
The Pope this week continued his weekly General Audiences in the Paul VI Audience Hall of The Vatican, albeit now with a socially distanced audience. There he sat on a throne in front of an elaborate wooden sculpture like a Final Fantasy boss for an hour long service.
Read more
articles.title: Undertale music played at the Pope's latest audience

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Westworld series co-creator Jonathan Nolan is set to direct the premiere of Amazon's Fallout TV series, Deadline reports.
Production begins this year. Geneva Robertson-Dworet (Captain Marvel) and Graham Wagner (Silicon Valley) are showrunners. There's no release window yet.
Read more
articles.title: Westworld series co-creator Jonathan Nolan to direct Amazon's Fallout TV show premiere

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
This six-minute slice shows open-world exploration, Pokémon catching, battling and Pokédex-filling. It also, still, leans heavily into those sweet Zelda: Breath of the Wild vibes.
Read more
articles.title: Pokémon Legends Arceus evokes Breath of the Wild in new six-minute overview trailer

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
E3 will not be held in its traditional in-person form this year, its organiser the ESA has confirmed. 
Some kind of digital offering may be held instead - as it was last year - but even that now seems uncertain. 
Read more
articles.title: E3 rules out physical show this year

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The annual event highlights speedruns, gameplay showcases, and competitions, with this year's event raising money for Prevent Cancer Foundation.
Read more
articles.title: Speedrunning event Awesome Games Done Quick starts this weekend

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Sony really doesn't want you to forget Horizon Forbidden West is out next month, so it's shared yet more details on its upcoming blockbuster. 
A new video released today outlines five different tribes that roam around the world of Horizon, as well a mysterious sixth tribe far in the Forbidden West which remains ambiguous. 
Read more
articles.title: Guerilla reveals Horizon Forbidden West's new factions

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
DICE has removed the fan-favourite Rush game mode from the featured playlist in Battlefield 2042's Portal mode.
The removal comes despite the positive reception towards the mode and calls to keep it in the game permanently. 
Read more
articles.title: DICE removes fan-favourite Rush mode from Battlefield 2042's official playlist

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Members of the UK video game industry have paid warm tributes to Just Add Water founder Stewart Gilray, who has died aged 51.
Gilray, who headed up the Leeds-based developer of Gravity Crash and various Oddworld titles after founding the studio in 2006, was hospitalised with Covid just before Christmas, and after fighting the disease over the last few weeks, passed away this morning.
Read more
articles.title: Tributes paid after Just Add Water founder Stewart Gilray dies aged 51

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
However, this is also because Christmas is actually yet to arrive for many players - but should finally turn up today.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Valhalla update fixes bug which blocked Christmas

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Sony's 2022 CES event caught our attention with technical details of PlayStation VR2 - but what initially slipped under the radar was a small tale by Tom Holland, who was brought onto the stage to talk about the wonders of Uncharted. 
The 25-year-old English actor who has a habit of playing Americans noted that he only discovered Uncharted when a PlayStation 4 was left in his trailer during the filming of Spider-Man: Homecoming (thanks, Kotaku). 
Read more
articles.title: Tom Holland says he's Nathan Drake because Sony left him a PS4 and a copy of Uncharted

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Wordle captured the attention of the internet over the Christmas holidays, and now my Twitter feed is a constant stream of people sharing their scores. 
Read more
articles.title: Wordle creator says plan is to stay free, and ad-free

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
A number of high-profile FIFA Ultimate Team traders have reported being targeted by hackers who have cleared out their accounts of FIFA Points and coins.
Reports indicate that in the past week the top 100 traders in Ultimate Team have been targeted, with several saying they have lost access to their accounts and thousands of pounds worth of in-game currency.
Read more
articles.title: FIFA Ultimate Team traders say they're being targeted by hackers who are clearing their accounts of FIFA Points and coins

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A new trailer for Bomb Rush Cyberfunk shows off BMX cycling for the first time.
A spiritual successor to Dreamcast cult classic Jet Set Radio, developer Team Reptile has captured that game's cel-shaded graphics and sense of cool.
Read more
articles.title: New Bomb Rush Cyberfunk teaser shows BMXing for the first time

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
This is the new roguelike mode where you play as Pagan Min, the antagonist of Ubisoft's Himalayan-set Far Cry 4. Here, you'll journey into his "troubled psyche" and hear more about his backstory. 
Read more
articles.title: Far Cry 6 gets new roguelike DLC next week

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Nobody Saves The World, the next game from Guacamelee developer Drinkbox Studios, is due out later this month on PC and Xbox.
Unlike the team's previous luchador Metroidvania, Nobody Saves The World is an action RPG with an emphasis on creating your own personal playstyle.
Read more
articles.title: Nobody Saves The World due out later this month

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Activision has issued a statement regarding the ongoing strikes by QA staff members at Raven Software.
A spokesperson told GamesIndustry.biz that "Raven leadership has engaged in dialogue with its staff to hear concerns and explain the company's overall investment in development resources. As previously announced, we are growing our overall investment in development and operations resources and converting nearly 500 temporary workers to full-time employees across our studios, the largest conversion in Activision's history."
Read more
articles.title: Activision responds to ongoing worker strike at Raven Software

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Castlevania's 35th anniversary will be marked by the launch of the "Konami Memorial NFT Collection", which is exactly as it sounds. 
Artwork, video clips and music tracks will be hawked as NFTs on the OpenSea auction site next week, from 12th January, using the controversial Ethereum currency.
Read more
articles.title: Konami celebrates Castlevania's 35th anniversary with an NFT collection

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
The director of Days Gone has said "local studio management always made us feel like it was a big disappointment", and called Sony's decision not to greenlight a sequel "weird".
Reacting to the news that Sucker Punch's PlayStation exclusive Ghost of Tsushima has now sold over 8m copies, Days Gone director Jeff Ross said that when he left Sony in late 2020, the zombie game had already sold over 8m copies - and it has since gone on to sell even more, plus over a million sales on Steam.
Read more
articles.title: Days Gone director says "local studio management always made us feel like it was a big disappointment"

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Ubisoft's upcoming co-op PvE shooter Rainbow Six Extraction is a day-one release for Xbox Game Pass and PC Game Pass members.
This means subscribers can play the game on Xbox consoles and PC from Extraction's launch on 20th January.
Read more
articles.title: Rainbow Six Extraction launches day-one on Xbox and PC Game Pass

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
One of Mass Effect's most popular finale mods is now available for the trilogy's Legendary Edition. 
This latest version of the so-called Happy Ending Mod adds many of the tweaks from previous iterations into a package which slots neatly into the Legendary Edition of BioWare's space opera trilogy.
Read more
articles.title: Mass Effect 3's Happy Ending fan mod now available for Legendary Edition

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
An unofficial fan-made remake of Resident Evil: Code Veronica is due out this year.
Aiming to be in-line with Capcom's own remakes of Resident Evil 2 and 3, the Code Veronica remake features upgraded visuals and a third-person camera, among other improvements.
Read more
articles.title: Resident Evil: Code Veronica is getting a remake this year, from fans

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Microsoft shared the news in a brief statement today, first reported by Windows Central. It's unclear where Raeburn is headed next.
Read more
articles.title: Playground Games co-founder departs

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Ghost of Tsushima has now sold over 8m copies.
Sony's open world samurai exclusive has proven exceptionally popular and, as we previously reported, it had sold 5m copies by November 2020.
Read more
articles.title: Ghost of Tsushima sales top 8 million

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Here we see the full cargo plane fight scene glimpsed in previous trailers, and heavily inspired by Uncharted 3. 
Read more
articles.title: Watch the Uncharted film's full cargo plane fight scene

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Activision has filed a lawsuit against cheat site EngineOwning for selling cheats for Call of Duty: Warzone, as well as other online shooters.
The lawsuit, filed in the Central District of California, accuses EngineOwning of "trafficking for circumvention devices", "intentional interference with contractual relations", and "unfair competition".
Read more
articles.title: Activision files lawsuit against Call of Duty cheat site

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
The souped-up Death Stranding Director's Cut will come to PC via Steam and the Epic Games Store this spring.
This is the version which arrived first for PlayStation 5 last summer, now with Intel's fancy XeSS super sampling technology too.
Read more
articles.title: Death Stranding Director's Cut launches for PC this spring

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Dead by Daylight developer Behaviour Interactive has removed unlockable masks for the Leatherface killer used by some players for racist harassment.
Known as The Cannibal in the game, Leatherface (from the Texas Chainsaw Massacre films) players can unlock masks to wear based on the game's playable survivors - just like the film character.
Read more
articles.title: Behaviour removes Dead by Daylight cosmetics following racist harassment

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
This first-person experience sees you play a new character who meets franchise star Aloy and other familiar faces, and hangs about in Guerrilla's familiar robo-dino post-apocalypse.
Read more
articles.title: Horizon Call of the Mountain announced for PlayStation VR2

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Turkish police have detained 40 people in relation to a money laundering scam run on Twitch.
As reported last year, a group of Turkish streamers netted $10m through Bit donations from stolen credit cards.
Read more
articles.title: Turkish police detain 40 suspects in Twitch money laundering scam

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
We've all heard of polishing a video game - developers and publishers often mention the phrase in the same breath as a delay announcement. Now we've got nail polish inspired by video games.
The announcement comes from Microsoft itself - there's an Xbox-inspired spring 2022 collection from nail polish brand OPI, and it includes 12 colours based on various Xbox bits and bobs, with game-related names to go along with them.
Read more
articles.title: Xbox nail polish unlocks a new Halo Infinite armour coating

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
PlayStation VR2, as it's now officially known, will boast 4K HDR OLED panels, offering a 110-degree field of view. These panels will have a resolution of 2000x2040 per eye, and frame rates of 90/120Hz.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation VR2 tech specs revealed

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Eve Online will host Doctor Who's most iconic enemies in an unprecedented crossover event, beginning next week on 13th January. 
A teaser for the crossover - dubbed The Interstellar Convergence - appeared on Eve's YouTube channel this afternoon but offers few clues as to exactly what will happen.
Read more
articles.title: Eve Online announces Doctor Who crossover event where you fight Daleks

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A fresh batch of games will be available for PS Plus subscribers from today.
First up is Persona 5: Strikers. Released last year for PS4, it's a follow-up to the critically acclaimed JRPG Persona 5 but with musuu-style combat alongside its teen drama.
Read more
articles.title: Fresh batch of games hit PS Plus and PS Now for January

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Respawn's well-received Star Wars: Jedi Fallen Order is available to claim and keep via Origin this month if you are an Amazon Prime subscriber. 
Copies of strategy epic Total War: Warhammer plus shooter World War Z: Aftermath are both also available to claim via the Epic Game Store.
Read more
articles.title: Star Wars: Jedi Fallen Order headlines January Amazon Prime games

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Rare's legendary GoldenEye 007 looks set to return - as detailed by a newly-leaked set of Xbox achievements.
The achievement list, which was scooped off Microsoft's servers by True Achievements, includes 55 new awards and 1000 Gamerscore for completing the game's campaign and playing its various multiplayer modes. Achievement artwork even includes screenshots from the classic James Bond shooter.
Read more
articles.title: GoldenEye 007 Xbox achievements leak points to new port

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The 2022 range of Samsung Neo QLED televisions will include a Gaming Hub that supports cloud streaming and NFTs.
Cloud game libraries from Stadia, GeForce Now and Utomik will be featured, with "more to come". Games can be played simply by pairing a compatible controller.
Read more
articles.title: New Samsung TVs will include cloud gaming and NFT support

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is among the games coming to Xbox Game Pass this month.
The sci-fi trilogy remaster will hit the service on console and PC (via EA Play) on 6th January, including all three games and DLC.
Read more
articles.title: Mass Effect: Legendary Edition leads January Xbox Game Pass additions

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Paul "Rushy" Rustchynsky tweeted to say the project will be announced this year and will come from the new Avalanche studio in Liverpool that opened last year.
Read more
articles.title: Driveclub director's next game won't be a racer

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Bloomberg has reported that, after nearly eight years of development, the next project from BioShock creator Ken Levine is in development hell.
The report is based on interviews with several of Levine's former colleagues at Ghost Story Games, the small studio set up by Levine following the launch of BioShock Infinite and his decision to subsequently shutter former studio Irrational Games.
Read more
articles.title: Former team members criticise BioShock creator Ken Levine's inability to actually release a game

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Square Enix president Yosuke Matsuda has published a letter in which he expresses hope that NFTs and blockchain technology will become a "major trend" in gaming.
In a New Year's letter, Matsuda expressed what he believes will be major areas of growth for the industry in 2022, including cloud gaming, AI, and blockchain games.
Read more
articles.title: Square Enix president believes NFTs and blockchain tech will be a "major trend" this year

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Fresh details have come to light of the once-planned sequel to Bully, Rockstar's brilliant schoolyard sim, as part of a new Game Informer report.
Bully 2 would have featured a vastly-expanded playable world three times the size of the original game, where every building could have been entered (legally or via forced entry). 
Read more
articles.title: Report details Rockstar's axed plans for Bully 2

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The next big reveal for Final Fantasy 16 will be in the spring, following delays due to COVID-19.
Producer Naoki Yoshida, who's also been busy with the recently released Endwalker expansion for Final Fantasy 14, wrote an update on the game's website explaining it's been delayed by almost half a year.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 16 news is due this spring

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
League of Legends maker Riot Games has agreed a $100m (£74m) settlement to finally end its long-running gender discrimination lawsuit.
The settlement, announced at the end of December, brings to a close the class action suit filed by employees back in 2018. 
Read more
articles.title: Riot Games agrees $100m gender discrimination settlement

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Hello! Over the next few days we're going to be going back over some of our favourite games and moments and themes and whatnot from this very strange year. We hope you enjoy looking back with us!
It started with a reveal that had the internet thirsting; it ended with voice actress Maggie Robertson winning best performance at The Game Awards. 2021 was the year of Lady Dimitrescu.
Read more
articles.title: 2021 in review: Lady Dimitrescu: Icon of the year

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The statement was released on the Treyarch Twitter account earlier this week.
Read more
articles.title: Women of Treyarch say inclusive working environment is "our highest priority"

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The Steam Winter Sale is now live until 5th January 2022.
Yes it's that time of year to go trawling through your wishlist to grab any discounted games and add to your 2021 backlog.
Read more
articles.title: The Steam Winter Sale is now live

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Weird West, the new Devolver Digital-published game from Arkane Studios co-founder Raphaël Colantonio, has been delayed until 31st March 2022.
Due out on PC, Xbox and PlayStation, it was originally given a January release date but that's been delayed to iron out remaining issues.
Read more
articles.title: Weird West delayed into March 2022

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Void Interactive has lost the publisher for its SWAT game Ready or Not days after comments suggested it would include a school shooting mission.
The game was released in early access on 17th December, but in a statement on Twitter Void Interactive said it had parted ways with publisher Team17.
Read more
articles.title: SWAT game loses publisher following school shooting comments

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Tesla is being investigated by US regulators for the dangerous potential of its Passenger Play feature.
As previously reported, Sega's Sonic the Hedgehog has been added to Tesla vehicles alongside other games, with the intention of providing entertainment to passengers. However, the feature is also accessible to drivers.
Read more
articles.title: Tesla investigated by US regulators for letting drivers play games

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
EA cancelled a Harry Potter MMO game as it didn't believe in the longevity of the IP.
Twitch streamer The Real Brandolorian interviewed Kim Salzer, who was EA's director of product marketing from 2000-2003.
Read more
articles.title: A Harry Potter MMO was "killed" by EA for lack of belief in the IP

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
FIFA 22 is the UK's Christmas number one this year, at least by physical sales.
EA's football game is followed by Among Us and Call of Duty: Vanguard, according to the latest sales report from GSD.
Read more
articles.title: FIFA 22 is the UK's Christmas number one

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The PlayStation Store's Holiday Sale begins today with discounts on exclusive games.
The promotion will run until 19th January 2022, with more games set to be added on 5th January 2022.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation Holiday Sale launches today

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Halo Infinite's holiday event Winter Contingency has launched, featuring various Christmas related rewards.
The free event runs until 4th January 2022 with ten rewards available.
Read more
articles.title: Halo Infinite's Winter Contingency event launches

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Ubisoft's NFT platform Quartz has been hit with a considerable backlash, especially as the numbers so far appear laughable.
Yet in an interview with Decrypt, Ubisoft's blockchain technical director Didier Genevois said the company will "stay true" to its principles.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft to continue with NFT platform Quartz despite criticism

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A previously unreleased 2D intro cinematic for Sonic RPG Sonic Chronicles has surfaced online.
Released in 2008 for the Nintendo DS, Sonic Chronicles: Dark Brotherhood was an RPG developed by Bioware with turn-based combat.
Read more
articles.title: Unreleased hand drawn cinematic for Bioware's Sonic RPG surfaces online

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Twitch co-founder Justin Kan last week launched a new platform to sell NFTs, but its Discord server was hacked and hit by an NFT-selling scam.
Fractal is Kan's new venture, essentially a marketplace for selling in-game items and cosmetics as NFTs on the blockchain. 
Read more
articles.title: Twitch co-founder's new NFT platform hit with NFT scam through Discord hack

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The Final Fantasy 6 pixel remaster now has a release date of February 2022.
Square Enix has been re-releasing its early games on mobile and Steam, with Final Fantasy 6 being the last installment in the collection.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 6 pixel remaster due February 2022

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
As the games industry reels from NFT backlash, a new mod has been created for Doom 2 that allows you to screenshot monkeys.
NFT Doom, a mod by Ultra.Boi, allows you to race through hell with demons replaced by those demonic apes from Bored Ape Yacht Club often sold as NFTs.
Read more
articles.title: Let off steam with this Doom NFT mod

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Intel chief Pat Gelsinger has reiterated the global chip shortage is set to continue into 2023.
That's despite manufacturers rushing to step up production to meet demand.
Read more
articles.title: Intel chief reiterates global chip shortage will continue into 2023

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Staff are leaving Ubisoft in what's been dubbed "the great exodus".
As reported by Axios, there's been a wave of resignation from the company over the past 18 months at all levels of the business.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft staff leaving in "the great exodus"

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy - The Definitive Edition has received mixed reviews from the community and reviewers alike, thanks to a myriad of technical issues and contentious artistic choices. 
In response, Rockstar promised to make amends by giving PC owners the classic PC versions at no additional cost when purchased through the Rockstar Games Launcher. 
Read more
articles.title: PC owners of the GTA Trilogy remaster can claim an extra game for free

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Ubisoft's NFT platform, Quartz, caused quite a stir when it was announced at the beginning of the month.
The publisher revealed Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Breakpoint was to be the first game to offer NFTs in a beta trial in select countries not including the UK.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft appears to have sold a grand total of 15 NFTs

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
It's been out for less than a week on PC, but modders have already started work on manipulating Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade. 
As you might expect, the mods range in quality from hilarious to crass. 
Read more
articles.title: PC gamers are already modding Final Fantasy 7 Remake

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
The first season of Battlefield 2042 won't be released until March next year at the earliest. 
That's according to Battlefield dataminer temporyal, who reportedly found 12 weeks of pre-season weekly challenges in the game client.
Read more
articles.title: Battlefield 2042's first season reportedly won't be released until March 2022

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
PlayStation Plus subscribers who previously redeemed a digital copy of Final Fantasy 7 Remake will be able to upgrade to the PlayStation 5 version from Wednesday at no extra cost. 
The enhanced version released in June and was a free upgrade for paid owners of the game, but not for players who scored their copy through PlayStation Plus.
Read more
articles.title: PS Plus owners of Final Fantasy 7 Remake get free PS5 upgrade this week

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Resident Evil Village is reportedly our most-completed game of 2021.
According to the users on the site HowLongToBeat.com (thanks, Axios) - a user-led site that helps gamers see how long a game is before picking it up, even differentiating by main story, main plus extras, and completionist runs - of all the games that released in 2021 (and there was a lot of 'em), its users were mostly keen to see the conclusion of Resident Evil Village.
Read more
articles.title: Resident Evil Village is our most-completed game of 2021

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Even Microsoft is struggling to get ahold of its own Xbox Series X consoles as the global shortages continue to affect the industry.
For Halo Infinite's first Halo Championship Series, the company has had to resort to using dev kits - that is, special consoles given to developers to test games during development - as it cannot source enough retail versions.
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft can't get hold of retail Xbox Series X consoles for this weekend's Halo tournament

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
A pamphlet given away at a Japanese retail store has revealed more details about the upcoming racer, Gran Turismo 7, including news it will include 420 different car models and over 90 racing tracks "with realistic weather and scenery".
As spotted by GT Planet, the free booklet distributed at Yodobashi Camera reminds us that the "long-awaited GT Mode" is back, in which "you can enjoy the car life" and "buying, selling, and tuning the cars and racing". 
Read more
articles.title: Gran Turismo 7 will include 420 car models and 90 tracks

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Android 21 (Lab Coat) will soon join the fight in Dragon Ball FighterZ.
The unexpected news of a new DLC character was revealed during this weekend's Jump Festa 2022. You can see her in action in the new, and exceedingly brief, teaser below:
Read more
articles.title: Android 21 (Lab Coat) is coming to Dragon Ball FighterZ

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
If you were hoping that Little Devil Inside's delay to 2022 would see a release early next year, you may need to adjust your expectations. 
Although neither the development team nor Sony have formally confirmed the game's release date, a new video teaser on PlayStation's Instagram account has revealed Little Devil Inside will release in "Winter 2022", which is a little more specific than just 2022.
Read more
articles.title: Looks like Little Devil Inside will release towards the end of 2022

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Hades is the very first video game to ever win a Hugo award, an annual literary award for the best science fiction or fantasy works of the year.
Though there's currently no best video game category, as per the World Science Fiction Convention, a one-off category was created for this year, and a permanent award is under consideration.
Read more
articles.title: Hades is the first video game to ever win the Hugo Award literary prize

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Halo Infinite players have discovered a way to glitch into couch co-op.
While there's no officially sanctioned way to join a pal in Halo Infinite for its story campaign - right now, we have to wait to at least May 2022 before the functionality is rolled out - players have discovered a new exploit, albeit one with very limited features and the extraordinarily strong possibility you'll lose your progress to date.
Read more
articles.title: Here's how to glitch your way into Halo Infinite couch co-op

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
The second season of Netflix's The Witcher adaptation may have only just premiered yesterday, but the team behind the show has seemingly already completed the scripts for season 3.
That said, we're still a long way off from getting to see the third series, as the creative process is reportedly "now really just starting".
Read more
articles.title: Season 3 of Netflix's The Witcher script is already written

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Knockout City's 4.0.2 patch is now live.
As well as the usual tweaks to gameplay and bugs, the patch also addresses issues that were introduced in Patch 4.0.
Read more
articles.title: Knockout City's new patch addresses the issues caused by the last patch

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
We knew it was coming, but now we know when - the new mini-console A500 Mini will release on 25th March, 2022.
Based on the Commodore Amiga 500 (also known as the A500), the Mini will be released on March 25, 2022.
Read more
articles.title: Here's the Amiga 500 Mini's release date and full details of its games library

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Amazon has confirmed which worlds will be merging within New World servers in US-East, US-West, Australia, and Central Europe. 
Community manager Luxendra advises that there will be "two separate times listed for these merges", "one for preparation and one for execution". 
Read more
articles.title: Amazon details New World server merger schedule

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Square Enix is releasing £80 bottles of wine inspired by Final Fantasy 14.
Based upon the Final Fantasy 14 Endwalker's Reaper job class and sold in a fancy presentation box, the wine has been produced in partnership with The Prisoner Wine company in California. Sadly, the wine is seemingly only available via Square Enix's Japanese store. 
Read more
articles.title: These Final Fantasy 14 inspired bottles of wine are £80

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If you've been enjoying your time sleuthing around the sunny, Mediterranean-inspired climes of Sherlock Holmes Chapter One, you might be interested to know that developer Frogwares has just released a brand-new case to crack in the form of its Beyond a Joke DLC.
Beyond a Joke, which is out now on PC, Xbox Series X/S, and PS5, serves up a new quest - the first of "three major bonus story content additions", as Frogwares puts it - in which young Sherlock Holmes and his chiselled jawline go on the hunt for an "unstoppable" thief targeting the island of Cordona's ultra-rich "with brazen gusto and open mockery".
Read more
articles.title: Sherlock Holmes Chapter One gets first "major bonus story" DLC Beyond a Joke

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
Actor Ernie Hudson, perhaps better known as Ghostbusters' Winston Zeddemore, has claimed a new video game based on the legendary movie series is "definitely happening".
This isn't the first time we've heard word of a new Ghostbusters game, of course; back in October, Raphael Saadiq, the co-founder of Friday the 13th and Predator: Hunter Grounds developer Illfonic, let slip that the studio was currently working on the title. Unsurprisingly though, given that the game is still yet to be officially announced, Saadiq hasn't offered any update since, leaving movie fans uncertain of the project's status.
Read more
articles.title: Ernie Hudson says new Ghostbusters game is "definitely happening"

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
There's a lot going on in the world of Back 4 Blood developer Turtle Rock today; not only has the studio announced it's been acquired by Chinese conglomerate Tencent, it's also just released the first big post-launch content update for its well-received co-op zombie shooter. The latter brings with it a range of tweaks and additions, the most notable of which is a much-requested solo offline mode with campaign progression.
First the acquisition news; as of today, following Tencent's purchase of Turtle Rock's parent company Slamfire, the studio is now wholly owned by the Chinese conglomerate. According to the announcement, Turtle Rock will continue to operate independently at its Lake Forest, California, offices, with co-founders Phil Robb and Chris Ashton remaining at the helm.
Read more
articles.title: Tencent acquires Back 4 Blood developer Turtle Rock Studios

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Far Cry 6 has now officially released its Danny Trejo crossover missions, after mistakenly making them available in an unfinished state.
Danny & Dani vs Everybody sees players teaming up with Trejo - who just plays himself - to help him move to Yara and "make his world-famous tasty tacos to feed the hungry".
Read more
articles.title: Far Cry 6's previously-pulled Danny Trejo DLC now officially released

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
additional Expansion Pack tier can enjoy five more Sega Mega Drive games from today. 
These include Sega's own Altered Beast, ToeJam & Earl, Dynamite Headdy and Sword of Vermillion, as well as Technosoft's Thunder Force 2. 
Read more
articles.title: Five Sega Mega Drive games join Nintendo Switch Online today

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Ian Hetherington, a pioneer of the British video games industry, has died. 
Hetherington was a founder of Imagine Software, Pysgnosis and Evolution Studios, and worked on games such as WipEout, Lemmings and Shadow of the Beast.
Read more
articles.title: Psygnosis and Evolution Studios founder Ian Hetherington dies

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
Minecraft, you probably don't need telling, is popular; it's sold over 238M copies since its launch in 2009 making it the best-selling game of all time, it claims over 140M monthly active users, and was enticing enough for Microsoft to spend an eye-watering $2.5 billion USD acquiring its developer Mojang back in 2014. And now here's another massive figure for the record books: it's officially the first game to surpass one trillion views on YouTube.
To celebrate the immense milestone, YouTube has launched a new website highlighting the creators and videos that helped Minecraft reach 1,000,000,000,000 views over the last decade - a figure that would, as YouTube points out to put it into some kind of perspective, amount to over 30,000 years if each view equated to just one second of time.
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft becomes first game to top one trillion views on YouTube

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If you've been eagerly awaiting news of the next instalment in the nearly three-decade-old Settlers series, your patience will soon be awarded: publisher Ubisoft has announced it'll be revealing more information on the long-delayed game in January next year.
Ubisoft first revealed it would be revisiting the Settlers' much-loved city-building and real-time strategy formula in a new series instalment back in 2018. At the time, it told fans to expect the title in autumn the following year but, as that window grew near, the publisher announced a delay, pushing the game's release into 2020.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft's long-delayed new Settlers game will be sharing "some news" in January

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
The Queen and the Sea, the third paid expansion for developer Motion Twin's majestic rogue-like action-platformer Dead Cells, will be coming to PlayStation, Xbox, Switch, and PC on 6th January next year, and there's a first trailer to celebrate the news.
The Queen and the Sea, which follows previous paid expansions The Bad Seed and Fatal Falls, brings a touch of the nautical to Dead Cells' acclaimed action, introducing new enemies, bosses, weapons, and two brand-new biomes - Infested Shipwreck and the Lighthouse - that'll run parallel to the existing High Peak Castle and Throne Room late-game stages.
Read more
articles.title: Dead Cells' The Queen and the Sea expansion gets January release date and first trailer

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
Red Candle Games, the developer behind critically acclaimed horror outings Detention and Devotion, has - following a bit of an animated tease earlier this year - formally announced its latest title, an action-platformer loosely inspired by From Software's superb Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice that's currently going by the name of Nine Sols.
Details are extremely limited right now, but Red Candle describes Nine Sols (a working title at present) as a "lore rich hand-drawn 2D platformer with Sekiro-inspired deflection-focused combat". The developer has also shared a wonderfully evocative bit of promo art that - while a significant aesthetic departure from its previous games - does suggest, with its mangled limbs and pools of blood, that we're not exactly in family friendly territory here.
Read more
articles.title: Detention and Devotion developer announces Sekiro-inspired action-platformer Nine Sols

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Pokémon Go developer Niantic has named a short list of locations where it will hold in-person events next February, as part of the game's Pokémon Go Tour: Johto celebration.
An initial day available to all players globally will take place on Saturday, 26th February - this was already announced and detailed. A separate, second day featuring in-person events with themed habitats will then be held on Sunday, 27th February.
Read more
articles.title: Pokémon Go announces short list of in-person event locations for February

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
Tis the season of festive sales in video game land, and the Epic Games Store has now thrown open its shutters and bellowed news of its own discount offerings into the cold winter night, which includes the return of its daily "mystery gift" free games, starting with Shenmue 3.
Shenmue 3 is, of course, the long, long, long-awaited third instalment in developer Yu Suzuki's classic action-adventure series, which finally arrived in 2019 following a gap of 18 years between it and its predecessor. Picking up where Shenmue 2 left off, part 3 sees protagonist Ryo Hazuki resume his quest for vengeance after the murder of his father in the original, delivering a new chapter that Eurogamer's Martin Robison called both "archaic and arcane" and "a worthy successor to what many consider an all-time great" in his review.
Read more
articles.title: Shenmue 3 kickstarts two weeks of daily freebies on the Epic Games Store from today

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
It's December, which means it's time for live-service games to add festive events into their playlists, Battlefield 2042 included. 
DICE has created a new game mode on Battlefield Portal for the holiday season.
Read more
articles.title: Battlefield 2042's winter event starts today with Santas vs elves mode

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Fortnite's annual Winterfest holiday event begins again today, with another relatively generous offering of free items, Christmas-themed quests for XP and yet more new things to spend money on.
More than a dozen items will be given away - some more exciting than others - including the Polar Peely reskin. If you don't have a Peely (or six) in your character collection yet, now is your chance. 
Read more
articles.title: Fortnite's Winterfest begins today, offers free frozen banana man

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Chicory: A Colorful Tale is available now on Nintendo Switch with revised control methods.
Surprise-announced last night at the Nintendo Indie Showcase, the Switch version features touch and motion controls that could considerably change the way the game plays.
Read more
articles.title: Chicory: A Colorful Tale out now on Switch with new controls

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Workers at Vodeo Games have unionised, creating North America's first ever official video game studio union. 
Vodeo Workers United consists of roughly 13 full-time employees and contractors working remotely across the US and Canada, and has been voluntarily recognised by Vodeo's management. 
Read more
articles.title: North America gets its first video game studio union

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
343 has promised significant changes to the structure of time-limited events in time for the return of Fracture: Tenrai in January. 
For those out of the loop, Fracture: Tenrai was Halo Infinite's first time-limited event, and it received severe criticism from the community for numerous reasons, including 343 selling  premium Samurai-themed cosmetics in the game's store. 
Read more
articles.title: 343 promises drastic changes to Halo Infinite's events with the return of Fracture: Tenrai in January

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Life is Strange developer Dontnod has announced its first game as a third-party publisher.
Gerda: A Flame in Winter is a new narrative game from Danish studio PortaPlay and was announced at the recent Nintendo Indie Showcase.
Read more
articles.title: Dontnod announces first game as third-party publisher

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Legacy, the upcoming NFT-funded game from Fable creator Peter Molyneux, has already raked in around $53m (£40m). 
Hopeful speculators can purchase imaginary land in the game, which is not due out until some point next year, and are indeed apparently doing so. 
Read more
articles.title: Peter Molyneux's NFT game Legacy has already sold $50m of "land"

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A French trade union representing Ubisoft Paris staff members has heavily criticised the company's move into blockchain technology.
Last week Ubisoft announced its new NFT platform, Quartz, for unique items in AAA games it promises will run on "energy-efficient technology".
Read more
articles.title: French trade union criticises Ubisoft Quartz as "a useless, costly, ecologically mortifying tech"

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
CD Projekt, developer of Cyberpunk 2077, has reached a settlement with investors who were unhappy with the game's disasturous launch last year. 
Last week, word broke that CD Projekt was now looking to settle investor complaints out of court - following several lawsuits being filed, then rolled into one.
Read more
articles.title: Cyberpunk 2077 developer settles disgruntled investors for just $1.85m

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A glitch that turned villagers into nudists in Animal Crossing: New Horizons has reportedly been fixed in a new update.
The latest patch, Version 2.0.4., fixes a number of issues in the base game and DLC. The nude glitch isn't specifically mentioned, presumably as it's not something Nintendo wishes to acknowledge.
Read more
articles.title: Animal Crossing nudist glitch reportedly removed

articles.author: Ishraq Subhan
articles.description:
Bungie's head of HR, Gayle d'Hondt, has stepped down from the company following the release of a report last week which alleged multiple instances of sexism and workplace toxicity at the studio.
In a company-wide email seen by IGN, D'Hondt said the company's people team needs to "move forward" with staff "largely comprised of people new to Bungie."
Read more
articles.title: Bungie's head of HR steps down

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Due to ongoing congestion issues, Final Fantasy 14 has been temporarily suspended from sale.
In addition, the free trial is now no longer available for new players. Existing trial players have also been deprioritised in the queue.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14 is so popular it's been pulled from sale

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
343 Industries has released a new Halo Infinite hotfix, aiming to tackle Quick Resume issues reported by Xbox Series X/S players last week.
The incident saw players reporting that earned cosmetics were failing to show up in multiplayer inventories - which in turn saw 343 warning against using Xbox's Quick Resume feature during Halo Infinite's campaign, with developer explaining the issue was caused by Quick Resume failing to get sessions back online.
Read more
articles.title: Halo Infinite's latest hotfix tackles Quick Resume issues on Xbox Series X/S

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
Inscryption, the acclaimed deck-building horror game from Pony Island and The Hex developer Daniel Mullins, is getting a free new mini-expansion that will turn its devilishly enjoyable opening act into an endless, rogue-like experience.
As with Mullins' previous creations, Inscryption - a dizzyingly strange blend of deck-building rogue-like, escape-room puzzler, and psychological horror - loves to surprise, which inevitably means some deviation away from its opening portion, a engaging combination of sharply designed card battling and Slay-the-Spire-style map progression. 
Read more
articles.title: Card horror Inscryption's free mini-expansion turns Act 1 into an endless rogue-like

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If you're a fan of Switch and indie games (which I assume you are, unless you got lost browsing the site) but found yourself otherwise indisposed during Nintendo's latest Indie World showcase, you missed a typically packed event. This time around, we got a look at The Messenger developer's gorgeous retro-inspired RPG Sea of Stars, a first glimpse of WayForward's beat-'em-up sequel River City Girls 2, tearjerking fox adventure in Endling: Extinction is Forever, a release date for the striking, skateboarding OlliOlli World, and plenty more. Those wanting a convenient catch-up will find everything shown below.
Sea of Stars
Read more
articles.title: Here's everything that appeared during Nintendo's latest Indie World showcase

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
OlliOlli World, the ambitious new entry in developer Roll7's acclaimed skateboarding series, finally has a release date and will be coming to Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, and PC on 8th February next year.
OlliOlli World takes the wonderfully satisfying skateboard-infused action-platforming of its predecessors and transplants it into the striking - and, for the first time in the series, fully 3D - world of Radlandia, a kingdom forged by the skateboard gods.
Read more
articles.title: OlliOlli World gets February 2022 release date and expansion pass

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Loco Motive, which looks like a cross between Monkey Island and Murder on the Orient Express, has been announced for Nintendo Switch as part of this evening's Indie World presentation.
A comedy adventure game with puzzles, Loco Motive has you playing as three passengers who must prove their innocence after a murder occurs.
Read more
articles.title: Loco Motive is a LucasArts-inspired point-and-click comedy adventure

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Ubisoft has announced it's working on a Splinter Cell remake.
The remake is in development at Far Cry 6 lead studio Ubisoft Toronto, and is being built on Ubisoft's Snowdrop engine - the same engine used to develop Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora and Ubisoft's upcoming Star Wars game.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft announces Splinter Cell remake

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Horizon Forbidden West is one of Sony's biggest upcoming blockbusters headed to PlayStation 5 - so it's easy to forget the Zero Dawn follow-up is also coming to PS4.
Today, developer Guerrilla Games shared four images from the PS4 version of the game, which is set to debut at the same time - on 18th February 2022.
Read more
articles.title: Here's some Horizon Forbidden West PS4 screenshots

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
PlayStation has launched a new accessibility website to showcase the features of its PS4 and PS5 consoles.
The website lists core visual and audio features, as well as closed captions, controls and chat transcription.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation launches website to highlight accessibility of its consoles

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Battlesector is getting the Necrons as DLC.
Black Lab Games' well-received turn-based strategy game launched on PC earlier this year before arriving on consoles. The Necrons arrive during the first quarter of 2022.
Read more
articles.title: The Necrons are coming to Warhammer 40,000: Battlesector

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Stalker 2: Heart of Chernobyl will include NFTs when it's released next year.
Developer GSC Game World has announced its game will have its own "metaverse" that players can inhabit as a "metahuman" - an NFT in the form of an NPC.
Read more
articles.title: Stalker 2 to include "metaverse" of NFTs

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Distant Worlds 2 comes out 10th March 2022 on PC, publisher Slitherine has announced.
The 4X space strategy game is the follow-up to Code Force's 2010 real-time grand strategy wargame.
Read more
articles.title: Distant Worlds 2 out March 2022

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A free DLC expansion is available now for Lonely Mountains: Downhill.
Named Riley's Return, it adds a lost trail to Mount Riley, plus new challenges and unlockable earth-elemental customisation sets.
Read more
articles.title: Lonely Mountains: Downhill gets free DLC

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
Publisher Slitherine has revealed gameplay of Stargate: Timekeepers.
The video below shows nearly two minutes of gameplay from the campaign's first mission, Battle of Antarctica.
Read more
articles.title: First look at Stargate: Timekeepers gameplay

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Square Enix has come under fire for describing Forspoken protagonist Frey Holland, who is Black, as having a "hip-hoppy kind of walk". 
The comment was made during a recent preview session attended by Eurogamer, and was part of a section dedicated to the game's performance capture. 
Read more
articles.title: Forspoken developer raises eyebrows for describing game's Black protagonist as having "hip-hoppy" walk

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
There's a Terminator real-time strategy game in the works.
Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance is in development at Cats Who Play, maker of RTS Syrian Warfare, and published by Slitherine.
Read more
articles.title: Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance is a new RTS due out on PC in 2022

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Twitch has implemented a new feature that allows streamers to see the reasons why viewers have unsubscribed from their channel.
Listed in the Channel Analytics page, streamers can see aggregated and anonymous information on subscription cancellations.
Read more
articles.title: New Twitch unsubscribe feature receives mixed response from streamers

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A report has suggested Twitch's new paid boost feature has no real impact on viewer numbers.
The function was tested over the past month among a subsection of streamers in the US. It allows both viewers and streamers to pay to "boost" a stream to a front page slot for extra promotion.
Read more
articles.title: Twitch boost function reportedly has no real impact

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Last week, Myth of Empires was booted off Steam after allegations it had copied source code from Ark: Survival Evolved.
Now, it has emerged the studio behind Myth of Empires has launched legal proceedings aimed at getting its strategy game back on sale. 
Read more
articles.title: Myth of Empires studio sues Ark developer after Steam removal

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.description:
343 has tweaked Halo Infinite's challenges system for multiplayer again.
It's the third overall update to challenges and progression since Halo Infinite's multiplayer launched on 15th November.
Read more
articles.title: 343 tweaks Halo Infinite battle pass progression again to make challenges better

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Cult Japanese horror Ringu will make its way to Dead by Daylight in a new chapter next year.
Details of the chapter remain under wraps, but presumably there'll be a new killer, survivor and map based on the franchise.
Read more
articles.title: Next Dead by Daylight chapter to be based on cult Japanese horror Ringu

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If you're in the market for a thoroughly delightful distraction to help occupy those cold winter nights over the festive period (and who wouldn't be?), you might like to point your face in the direction of Ubisoft Connect, where the excellent Rayman Oranges is currently free on PC.
It's yet another offering in Ubisoft's 35th anniversary celebrations, which have previously seen the publisher tucking into its pockets of yore and slinging the likes of the Assassin's Creed Chronicles trilogy, Splinter Cell Chaos Theory, and Anno 1404: History Edition at PC players.
Read more
articles.title: Rayman Origins is currently free on PC

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
As part of its fascinating Power On documentary series released to celebrate the 20th anniversary of Xbox, Microsoft has discussed the time it rejected Rockstar's pitch to put Grand Theft Auto 3 on the original Xbox back in 2001 - a decision that would ultimately lead to the multi-million-selling phenomenon being snapped up by Sony as a timed exclusive.
The story, which follows similarly candid recollections from Microsoft in Power On - including the admission its closure of Fable developer Lionhead Studios was one of the company's "biggest missteps" - comes in the third episode. Here, various members of the original Xbox team discuss Microsoft's preparations for the console's launch, which saw the group going on a "barnstorming tour" across America, Europe, and Japan to build excitement and convince developers its machine could be a success.
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft recalls time it rejected Rockstar's pitch to put GTA3 on the original Xbox

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If you're curious about PlayStation Plus but haven't yet become a member - or have no intention of ever becoming a member, but have a sudden urge to play some online multiplayer games all the same - Sony is giving players two days to trial the subscription service this weekend.
PlayStation Plus, should you be unfamiliar, is required to play the vast majority of PlayStation 4 and PS5 multiplayer games online (although free-to-play titles such as Fortnite are excluded), and, as an extra incentive to subscribe, offers a monthly selection of games to add to your library for the duration of a membership at no extra cost.
Read more
articles.title: There's a free PlayStation Plus online multiplayer trial happening this weekend

articles.author: Matt Wales
articles.description:
If been wondering where Nightdive Studios' long-in-the-works System Shock remake has got to - given that it's previously announced "late summer" 2021 release window has very much been and gone - the developer says the project is now due to arrive some time next year. It'll be published by Koch Media's Prime Matter division and there are a selection of new screenshots to tide people over until more solid release date news comes their way.
It has, of course, been a long and eventful road for the System Shock remake, which was originally intended to be a remaster of Looking Glass Technologies' cult-classic 1994 sci-fi horror before ballooning in scope. By the time its Kickstarter commenced in July 2016, Nightdive was calling it a "reboot" and, after a rocky period of development, the studio announced it was putting the project on hiatus after letting "things get out of control".
Read more
articles.title: System Shock's long-in-the-works remake is now set to launch next year

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Its the latest game to join the Tesla in-car games service, which is compatible with USB controllers. The move comes after a new partnership between the Elon Musk car company and Sega. 
Read more
articles.title: Sonic the Hedgehog will become playable via Tesla

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Windjammers 2 is due out across consoles and PC next year, a sequel to the 1994 Neo Geo original.
It's an arcade fantasy sports game that sees two players in head-to-head power disc throwing matches.
Read more
articles.title: Windjammers sequel coming to consoles and PC next year

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Nintendo will hold its next indie-game focused presentation tomorrow, 15th December 2021, at 5pm UK time. (That's 9am Pacific, or 12pm Eastern.)
This edition of Nintendo Indie World will last around 20 minutes, and showcase a number of upcoming games coming to Nintendo Switch. 
Read more
articles.title: Nintendo Indie World presentation tomorrow

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
A newly-discovered hacking exploit has opened up the PlayStation 4 and Pro, and may work on a PS5 too.
A trio of console hackers have released the hack, which works on consoles with firmware update 9.00 and earlier, and allows for homebrew apps and unauthorised copies of games to be played.
Read more
articles.title: The PlayStation 4 has been hacked to allow for homebrew apps

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Video channel People Make Games has run an investigation into the developer of Roblox with some concerning revelations about child safety.
The channel previously ran a video accusing the Roblox Corporation of "exploiting" young game developers. The company has since asked People Make Games to remove that video, but instead new developments have come to light concerning the safety of children on the game platform.
Read more
articles.title: Roblox accused of being an unsafe environment for children

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Announced on the Xbox On YouTube channel, nine games will arrive on the platform on 16th December, just in time for Christmas.
Read more
articles.title: The Gunk leads new additions to Xbox Game Pass

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Final Fantasy kart racing game Chocobo GP now has a release date of 10th March 2022, exclusively on Nintendo Switch.
New details have emerged about both its single and multiplayer modes. A free-to-play version will also be available as Chocobo GP Lite, which includes access to the Story Mode prologue in single player mode, Chocobo GP mode, and both local and online multiplayer (if hosted by someone with the full game).
Read more
articles.title: Chocobo GP kart racer gets a release date

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
The Spanish studio became famous for its work on Castlevania: Lords of Shadow and, most recently, Metroid Dread.
Read more
articles.title: Mercury Steam releases remaster of first ever game

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Sony will release a new line of coloured accessories for the PS5 next year, including controllers and console covers.
The existing DualSense controllers in Midnight Black and Cosmic Red will be joined by Nova Pink, Starlight Blue and Galactic Purple.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation 5 console covers coming early next year

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Dr Dre has released a snippet of a song he's produced for GTA Online, along with Eminem.
The game will receive new content called The Contract on 15th December that sees GTA V character Franklin attempting to lure in Dr Dre to his "celebrity solutions agency".
Read more
articles.title: Dr Dre releases snippet of music from forthcoming GTA Online content

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Superman and The Witcher actor Henry Cavill has said he'd "love" to discuss being in the forthcoming Mass Effect TV series.
Cavill is currently doing press for the second season of The Witcher, which hits Netflix on 17th December.
Read more
articles.title: Henry Cavill would “love” to discuss being in the Mass Effect TV series

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Indie JRPG Edge of Eternity is on its way to consoles next year.
Released on PC earlier this summer, it will be available across PlayStation and Xbox consoles from 10th February 2022, with a cloud version following on Switch on 23rd February 2022.
Read more
articles.title: Indie JRPG Edge of Eternity headed to consoles next year

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Final Fantasy 14 director and producer Naoki Yoshida has once again apologised for congestion since the launch of Endwalker.
The latest expansion for the game, Endwalker was released in early access on 3rd December and officially released 7th December. Players have experienced hours long queue times to get into the game.
Read more
articles.title: Congestion issues continue in Final Fantasy 14

articles.author: Ed Nightingale
articles.description:
Peter Molyneux's next project is "an innovative new game that pushes the boundaries of blockchain gaming."
Named Legacy and developed by 22cans, it boasts being the first ever blockchain business sim. 
Read more
articles.title: Peter Molyneux is creating a blockchain business sim

articles.author: Tom Phillips
articles.description:
Microsoft has urged all Minecraft Java owners to update their game now to avoid a nasty security vulnerability.
The issue allows for remote code execution on Minecraft servers by pasting messages into a chat box, and was flagged online by tech security analysts last Friday. Eurogamer contacted Microsoft at the time.
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft warns of security vulnerability in Minecraft Java

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Microsoft has acknowledged its closure of Lionhead Studios was one of its "biggest missteps".
As reported by IGN, in the sixth part of Power On: The Story of Xbox - a six-part documentary detailing Microsoft's highs and lows across its Xbox brand - key figures talked about the acquisition and eventual closure of one of the UK's biggest studios in a bid to "not repeat" the "same mistakes".
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft acknowledges "missteps" in its handling of Lionhead Studios

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
A Slayer playlist is "officially locked and loaded" for Halo Infinite's update next week.
A "basic" Slayer offering will deploy first, with the team at 343 Industries looking to "bolster and expand more variants in a future update". 
Read more
articles.title: A Slayer playlist is coming to Halo Infinite next week

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
It looks like things will be getting seriously cold for Serious Sam 4. 
Croteam dropped a cryptic tease over the weekend, but at just 34 seconds long and the description "man, it's cold", we don't have a lot to go on right now.
Read more
articles.title: It looks like things may be getting cold for Serious Sam 4 and this possible DLC tease

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
A creepy Santa Claus is making the rounds following Phasmophobia's new Cursed Possessions update.
We knew something festive was happening following Kinetic Games' tease of a patch called the Christmas [REDACTED] Update a couple of weeks back, but now it looks like the new addition - described in the patch notes only as a "strange new ghost type" - is on the loose.
Read more
articles.title: Santa Claus is coming to town in Phasmophobia

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Atlus has teamed up with iam8bit to create a $400/£300 25th anniversary of Persona vinyl boxset.
The boxset boasts eight and a half hours of "newly remastered" music from right across the series on coloured vinyl "themed to each Persona".
Read more
articles.title: Atlus celebrates 25 years of Persona with this new $400 vinyl boxset

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
The opportunity to replay campaign modes in Halo Infinite is "coming later", according to 343 Industries associate creative director, Paul Crocker.
Acknowledging players may be frustrated that there's currently no way they can go back to enjoy and replay story missions, Crocker explained that pivoting to "nonlinear" gameplay makes replaying the campaign "incredibly challenging", but level select is "being worked on".
Read more
articles.title: Campaign level select in Halo Infinite is "challenging" but 343 Industries is "working" on it

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Details about Assassin's Creed Valhalla's next expansion, widely thought to be called Dawn of Ragnarok, have leaked via a Chinese web site.
Ubisoft announced Valhalla would be receiving a second year of updates back in June, confirming several new expansions were on the way, starting in 2022. The publisher is yet to share specifics but clues spotted in Valhalla's Trophy list have suggested the first will be titled Dawn of Ragnarök.
Read more
articles.title: There's been another big Assassin's Creed Valhalla expansion leak - this time with pictures

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Persona 3 Portable may be getting a "multiplatform" remaster.
As spotted by Nintendo Enthusiast, the same leaker that correctly teased that a remaster of Persona 4 Arena Ultimax was on the way has also revealed that a "multiplatform" remaster of Persona 3 Portable is possibly in development.
Read more
articles.title: Rumour has it a Persona 3 Portable remaster is in development

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
The Pokémon Center UK is now open.
Though currently running as a "beta" site - which means we're to expect "a few hiccups" - the Pokémon Center UK site caters directly to fans in the UK, offering a flat shipping fee of £5 per order.   
Read more
articles.title: The Pokémon Center UK is now open

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
While we already knew that Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade is coming to PC via Epic Games Store next week, 16th December, we now have a price: £65 in the UK, $70 in the US, and €80 in Europe.
Yes, that version includes both the photo mode and the Intergrade expansion that's currently only available on PlayStation 5 (thanks, PC Gamer), but it's the "standard" edition of a game - that is, a base version without a season pass, cosmetic items, or DLC etc. - and one of the first PC games to be sold at "next-gen" console prices.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade's standard edition will cost £65/$70 on PC

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Scorn - an "atmospheric first-person horror adventure" - will now release in October 2022.
Scorn was announced way back in 2016, and its Kickstarter campaign - which exceeded its €150,000 (£128,000) target by almost €50,000 (£42k) - initially intimated a launch date in October 2018. 
Read more
articles.title: Horror Scorn will now release in October 2022

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Bungie CEO Pete Parsons has apologised after a report alleged multiple instances of sexism and workplace toxicity at the studio.
IGN's report into alleged issues with Bungie's narrative team detailed "overt sexism, boys' club culture, crunch, and HR protection of abusers as well as more complex stories of microaggressions, systemic inequalities, and difficulties in being heard". 
Read more
articles.title: Bungie CEO apologises after damning report exposes a culture of "overt sexism" at the studio

articles.author: Vikki Blake
articles.description:
Sony has acquired Seattle-based Valkyrie Entertainment.
Founded in 2002, Valkyrie Entertainment works alongside other studios, "empowering them to achieve the full potential of their visions". Past projects include League of Legends, God of War, and Halo Infinite. The studio is thought to be currently contributing to the upcoming God of War sequel.
Read more
articles.title: Sony acquires Valkyrie Entertainment
